alert.note: Alert for Stillwater; Sweet Grass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 2:41PM MDT until June 08 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Billings has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Stillwater County in south central Montana... Central Sweet Grass County in south central Montana... * Until 545 PM MDT. * At 241 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Absarokee, Greycliff, Reed Point, Nye, Dean and Fishtail. At 2:20 PM MDT, the public reported standing water in and around Reed Point. Additional light rain showers will continue to push north through the region. Additional thunderstorm development is possible through the afternoon and evening hours. Any thunderstorms that do develop will have the potential to produce another quick 1 to 2 inches of rainfall. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
